info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:15PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Burst of Light Snow for Friday Morning Commute... * A fast moving cold front will bring a period of light snow to Western Nevada between 2 AM and 6 AM early Friday morning. * Snowfall amounts are expected to be light, mostly under 1 inch, but with colder air moving in, any snow could accumulate on roads and sidewalks down to valley floor elevations. * Plan for slick roads and delays during the morning commute Friday. It will be a good day to set an early alarm, to give yourself extra time to clean off your car and for travel. * A wetter storm with higher snowfall potential is projected for Saturday, which would produce larger travel disruptions to Western and Northern Nevada. Localized areas of lake effect snow could persist into Sunday south and southeast of Pyramid Lake and Tahoe, along with widespread dramatically colder temperatures.
